cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: near the north coast of the Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the Bahamas, then forecast to run near or along the southeast Florida coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast Florida coast (around Palm Beach County) or just offshore

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet (includes Palm Beach County)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for the Northwestern Bahamas; Tropical Storm Warning for the Dominican Republic, Haiti, Turks & Caicos, Southeastern and Central Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coast from Miami–Dade northward through Palm Beach County
weather_observation.wind: Port could experience sustained tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) with gusts possibly reaching hurricane force if Isaias strengthens near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center passes just offshore, onshore flow may push 1–3 ft of surge along the Palm Beach County shoreline and intracoastal waterways.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 2–4 inches with isolated amounts near 6 inches, producing urban and low-land flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; short-fused tornadoes in outer rain bands.
